title: Designing Elementary Science Concept Understanding and Classroom Behavior Patterns Using Participatory Visual Analogy Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Basic elementary science concepts and foundational instructional design theories
context.additional_context: Simulation/VR-based training course conducted in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment for office/administrative working professionals.

learning_goals: They present at least three instructional design frameworks explaining elementary science concepts through visual analogies and participatory activities
They develop at least two simulation/VR learning scenarios applying the PIA instructional method
Formative assessments measure changes in learners' conceptual understanding and class participation rates by at least 80%

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
